body:
In my dreams since childhood and still, if i am panicked or rushed or otherwise intensely moved i revert to what i suspect are embedded genetic patterns in my memory.

To fly away i run and run on 2 legs and stretch my arms and flex my upper back as i leap and then air catches me and i take off.  Or i just drop from a height.  I glide by maneuvering my head like a rudder and can feel strong neck muscles doing it.  Also my jaw will dip like Mario in mario 3 and i do these pop up and downs to keep a height.

If j am scared and run away my hips open like and my pelvis kinda retracts back and down and i run on all fours.  Except to fly I've maybe never in my dream life run as a human being. 

Is that a thing for anyone else?
body_html:
In my dreams since childhood and still, if i am panicked or rushed or otherwise intensely moved i revert to what i suspect are embedded genetic patterns in my memory.

To fly away i run and run on 2 legs and stretch my arms and flex my upper back as i leap and then air catches me and i take off. Or i just drop from a height. I glide by maneuvering my head like a rudder and can feel strong neck muscles doing it. Also my jaw will dip like Mario in mario 3 and i do these pop up and downs to keep a height.

If j am scared and run away my hips open like and my pelvis kinda retracts back and down and i run on all fours. Except to fly I've maybe never in my dream life run as a human being.

Is that a thing for anyone else?

post.title: does anyone dream with animal bodies?

body: I think I may have dreamt from the perspective of a small animal many years ago. A rabbit, maybe. I do dream a lot from the perspective and body of other people, though. This reminds me, has anyone ever died in a dream in a way that made everything go black with this sort of 'click' passing through their head? I feel like I felt it in my brain meat and that my eyes rolled back.
body_html: I think I may have dreamt from the perspective of a small animal many years ago. A rabbit, maybe. I do dream a lot from the perspective and body of other people, though. This reminds me, has anyone ever died in a dream in a way that made everything go black with this sort of 'click' passing through their head? I feel like I felt it in my brain meat and that my eyes rolled back.

post.body:
In my dreams since childhood and still, if i am panicked or rushed or otherwise intensely moved i revert to what i suspect are embedded genetic patterns in my memory.

To fly away i run and run on 2 legs and stretch my arms and flex my upper back as i leap and then air catches me and i take off.  Or i just drop from a height.  I glide by maneuvering my head like a rudder and can feel strong neck muscles doing it.  Also my jaw will dip like Mario in mario 3 and i do these pop up and downs to keep a height.

If j am scared and run away my hips open like and my pelvis kinda retracts back and down and i run on all fours.  Except to fly I've maybe never in my dream life run as a human being. 

Is that a thing for anyone else?
post.body_html:

I glide by maneuvering my head like a rudder and can feel strong neck muscles doing it. Also my jaw will dip like Mario in mario 3 and i do these pop up and downs to keep a height.

If j am scared and run away my hips open like and my pelvis kinda retracts back and down and i run on all fours. Except to fly I've maybe never in my dream life run as a human being.

Is that a thing for anyone else?
post.title: does anyone dream with animal bodies?
